embeddableConfig.description: Total count of RDP success and failed actions within the specified time.

panelsJSON.title: Total count of RDP success and failed actions within the specified time.

params.markdown: Monitoring RDP authentications is crucial for identifying unauthorized access and distinguishing between successful and failed login attempts. Security teams should analyze trends and cross-reference user activity for rapid response and mitigation.

attributes.description: Total count of users with login failures within the specified time.

embeddableConfig.description: Total count of users with login failures within the specified time.

panelsJSON.title: Total count of users with login failures within the specified time.

params.markdown: Monitoring failed RDP logins is essential for detecting unauthorized access attempts. Security teams should analyze patterns of failed entries against user and IP data to identify potential breaches. This focus helps in quickly addressing vulnerabilities in RDP security. Effective monitoring of these incidents is crucial for maintaining system integrity.

panelsJSON.title: Identifying Failed RDP Logins - Data [Logs Corelight]

embeddableConfig.description: Total count of VPN connections that have the following inferences NSP - Non-Standard Port RW - Road warrior configuration detected (i.e. Cisco Anyconnect) COM - Commercial VPN service occurring at the same time which is deemed suspicious.

panelsJSON.title: Total count of VPN connections that have the following inferences NSP - Non-Standard Port RW - Road warrior configuration detected (i.e. Cisco Anyconnect) COM - Commercial VPN service occurring at the same time which is deemed suspicious. [Logs Corelight]

params.markdown: The combination of the "COM", "RW", and "NSP" inferences in a single VPN connection raises questions: Policy Violation: Is the use of commercial VPNs allowed in your organization's security policy? If not, this could indicate a violation. Hidden Activity: Is the non-standard port usage an attempt to mask other activities happening over the VPN tunnel?

query.esql:
from logs-corelight.various-*
| limit 10000
| where observer.vendor == "Corelight" and event.dataset == "vpn" and observer.hostname is not null and vpn.inferences in ("COM", "NSP", "SK")
| stats count(),values(vpn.inferences), values(destination.geo.country_iso_code), values(vpn.name) by source.ip,destination.ip
| eval `values(vpn.inferences)` = mv_concat(`values(vpn.inferences)`,":")
| rename source.ip as Source, destination.ip as Responder, `values(destination.geo.country_iso_code)` as `Responder Country`, `values(vpn.name)` as `VPN Type`, `values(vpn.inferences)` as Inferences, `count()` as count
| keep Source, Responder,Inferences,`Responder Country`, `VPN Type`, count
| stats count()
| rename `count()` as `Suspected Data Exfiltration`

from logs-corelight.various-*
| limit 10000
| where observer.vendor == "Corelight" and event.dataset == "vpn" and observer.hostname is not null and vpn.inferences in ("COM", "NSP", "SK")
| stats count(),values(vpn.inferences), values(destination.geo.country_iso_code), values(vpn.name) by source.ip,destination.ip
| eval `values(vpn.inferences)` = mv_concat(`values(vpn.inferences)`,":")
| rename source.ip as Source, destination.ip as Responder, `values(destination.geo.country_iso_code)` as `Responder Country`, `values(vpn.name)` as `VPN Type`, `values(vpn.inferences)` as Inferences, `count()` as count
| keep Source, Responder,Inferences,`Responder Country`, `VPN Type`, count
| stats count()
| rename `count()` as `Suspected Data Exfiltration`

embeddableConfig.description: Total count of VPN connections using potentially unusual connection configurations such as static TLS key auth

panelsJSON.title: Total count of VPN connections using potentially unusual connection configurations such as static TLS key auth [Logs Corelight]

params.markdown:
Unmonitored commercial VPNs with atypical traffic patterns or static keys could be used to bypass security controls for data theft.

Investigate: Examine VPN sessions with large outgoing transfers, focusing on unusual destinations or protocols.

query.esql:
from logs-corelight.various-*
| limit 10000
| where observer.vendor == "Corelight" and event.dataset == "vpn" and observer.hostname is not null and vpn.inferences in ("COM", "NSP", "SK")
| stats count(),values(vpn.inferences), values(destination.geo.country_iso_code), values(vpn.name) by source.ip,destination.ip
| eval `values(vpn.inferences)` = mv_concat(`values(vpn.inferences)`,":")
| rename source.ip as `Source IP`, destination.ip as `Destination IP`, `values(destination.geo.country_iso_code)` as `Destination Country`, `values(vpn.name)` as `VPN Type`, `values(vpn.inferences)` as Inferences, `count()` as Count
| keep `Source IP`, `Destination IP`,Inferences,`Destination Country`, `VPN Type`, Count

from logs-corelight.various-*
| limit 10000
| where observer.vendor == "Corelight" and event.dataset == "vpn" and observer.hostname is not null and vpn.inferences in ("COM", "NSP", "SK")
| stats count(),values(vpn.inferences), values(destination.geo.country_iso_code), values(vpn.name) by source.ip,destination.ip
| eval `values(vpn.inferences)` = mv_concat(`values(vpn.inferences)`,":")
| rename source.ip as `Source IP`, destination.ip as `Destination IP`, `values(destination.geo.country_iso_code)` as `Destination Country`, `values(vpn.name)` as `VPN Type`, `values(vpn.inferences)` as Inferences, `count()` as Count
| keep `Source IP`, `Destination IP`,Inferences,`Destination Country`, `VPN Type`, Count

attributes.title: Table Source IP & Destination IP & Inferences & Destination Country & VPN Type

query.esql:
from logs-corelight.various-*
| limit 10000
| where observer.vendor == "Corelight" and event.dataset == "vpn" and observer.hostname is not null and vpn.inferences in ( "RW", "FW" )
| stats count(), values(source.ip),values(destination.ip), values(proto),values(vpn.inferences), values(destination.port),values(source.bytes) by event.id
| rename `values(source.ip)` as Source, `values(destination.ip)` as Destination, `values(proto)` as Proto, `values(vpn.inferences)` as Inferences,`values(destination.port)` as dest_port,`values(source.bytes)` as Bytes, `count()` as count
| keep Source, Destination,Proto,Inferences,dest_port,Bytes,count
| stats count()
| rename `count()` as `Possible Unauthorized Remote Access Attempts`

from logs-corelight.various-*
| limit 10000
| where observer.vendor == "Corelight" and event.dataset == "vpn" and observer.hostname is not null and vpn.inferences in ( "RW", "FW" )
| stats count(), values(source.ip),values(destination.ip), values(proto),values(vpn.inferences), values(destination.port),values(source.bytes) by event.id
| rename `values(source.ip)` as Source, `values(destination.ip)` as Destination, `values(proto)` as Proto, `values(vpn.inferences)` as Inferences,`values(destination.port)` as dest_port,`values(source.bytes)` as Bytes, `count()` as count
| keep Source, Destination,Proto,Inferences,dest_port,Bytes,count
| stats count()
| rename `count()` as `Possible Unauthorized Remote Access Attempts`

embeddableConfig.description: Total count of VPN connections that are using the RW- Road warrior configuration detected (i.e. Cisco Anyconnect) and FW - Firewall subversion inferences

panelsJSON.title: Total count of VPN connections that are using the RW- Road warrior configuration detected (i.e. Cisco Anyconnect) and FW - Firewall subversion inferences [Logs Corelight]

params.markdown: Monitoring for "RW" (Road Warrior) and "FW" (Firewall subversion) inferences is crucial for detecting potential unauthorized access, as these patterns may indicate attempts to bypass security controls. Security teams should prioritize correlating these inferences with internal IP ranges and device logs to identify suspicious activities.
